perturbation.original_text:
27. RESOLUTION OF DISPUTES

27.1 If a dispute should arise under this Agreement between or among the Parties they shall make every reasonable effort to resolve such dispute. However, in the event that they are unable to resolve such dispute, the matter shall be referred to the Management Committee which shall either resolve the matter or determine the method, such as arbitration, by which the matter should be resolved. This procedure shall be the sole and exclusive remedy for any dispute which may arise under this Agreement between or among the Parties. The performance of this Agreement by the Parties shall continue during the resolution of any dispute.
perturbation.changed_text:
31. CONFIDENTIALITY

31.1 All data and information that is acquired or received by any Party in connection with the APCN 2 in anticipation of or under this Agreement shall be held confidential and shall not be divulged in any way to any third party, without the prior approval of the Management Committee. If a dispute should arise under this Agreement between or among the Parties they shall make every reasonable effort to resolve such dispute. However, in the event that they are unable to resolve such dispute, the matter shall be referred to the Management Committee which shall either resolve the matter or determine the method, such as arbitration, by which the matter should be resolved.
perturbation.explanation: The resolution of disputes (arbitration) section has been moved to the Confidentiality section, where parties would not expect to find the policy for how disputes are resolved. This obscures the clarity and enforceability of the dispute resolution process.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and conspicuous placement of important terms like dispute resolution clauses. Singaporean contract law also emphasizes clarity.

perturbation.original_text:
25. COMPLIANCE WITH LAW

In the performance of their obligations hereunder, the Parties agree to comply with all applicable laws of all Countries having jurisdiction over the activities performed under or stipulated by this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
33. FORCE MAJEURE

If any Party cannot fulfill its obligations in this Agreement due to an event beyond its reasonable control, including, but not limited to lighting, flood, exceptionally severe weather, fire or explosion, civil disorder, war or military operations, national or local emergency,In the performance of their obligations hereunder, the Parties agree to comply with all applicable laws of all Countries having jurisdiction over the activities performed under or stipulated by this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The compliance with the law section has been moved to the force majeure section, which is a less conspicuous place for such a crucial clause. This obscures the clause's prominence and could reduce its enforceability. Moving Compliance with Law to Force Majeure does not make logical sense.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and conspicuous placement of important terms like compliance with law. Singaporean contract law also emphasizes clarity.
